name: Hotel le Lavoisier

reviews.text: A very nice hotel with excellent service. The rooms are small compared to North American standards, but very comfortable and well appointed. There is no shower curtain in the bathroom, so be careful not to get the entire bathroom wet! If you need an iron and board, you can ask for one at the front desk.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel

reviews.text: We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel - very expensive at 14 euros. You can walk up the street to one of the cafes and get a continental breakfast for half the price.
reviews.title: Lavoisier lacking
Very good hotel
reviews.text: There is a lovely cozy lounge on the ground level - perfect for an evening nightcap. It's an honour bar, so you help yourself and just let the front desk know what you had. Great selection.
OTHER PARIS OBSERVATIONS
reviews.title: A great hotel in a great area
A lovely hotel
reviews.text: Warning: taxis can be hard to come by - if you reserve one in advance, there is an additional 8 euro charge to your fare. My advice: there is a taxi stand at the corner of Malesherbes and Haussman - wait there for a cab and don't pay extra. Otherwise, take the "metro" or walk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hotel Le Lavoisier with 2 other couples on a quick 3 night trip to Paris. We were very pleased with our experience. The rooms were roomy by European standards and very clean. The location is a bit off the "beaten" tourist path...but still in walking distance to several major attractions and close to a metro line. The location gives you a more local feel.
reviews.title: Hotel Le Lavoisier - an intimate hotel

reviews.text: We requested and received early check ins and rooms on higher floors based on recommendations from this web site. Our rooms were on the 5th floor. Our room faced the street side with a balcony and with the french door open you could hear street noises (not overly loud) but with the door closed it was nice and quiet. Our friends both had rooms on the courtyard side and said their rooms were quiet.
reviews.title: Personally.. .

reviews.text: The bathrooms did not have shower curtains - which is vry common in European hotels but often a surprise to the American traveler.
reviews.title: So nearly excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all extremely friendly and spoke perfect English. They made us feel right at home.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel But Substandard Beds and Pillows

reviews.text: The only negative that I can even mention is the 28 euros for the contintental breakfast----their are so many nice cafes in the general vicinity- it really is not worth it. We took advantage of this only on the last day on a Sunday morning when all the local cafes were closed and we were on our way to the airport.
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 7th trip to Paris and we read about the Hotel Le Lavoisier in an old Travel & Leisure Magazine checked it out online and e-mailed the hotel for a reservation. My husband & I enjoyed our stay. Nicely sized and well furnished, with wonderfully comfortable beds and very very clean. The entire staff is extremely helpful and very accommodating. Even though our room faced the street we slept undisturbed. The breakfast, which by the way is from 7am to 11am, was a nice touch for late sleepers and was a perfect start to our day. The location was excellent and the hotel and rooms were exactly as pictures on the hotel website. For the level of quality and staff’s ability to make you feel at home is why this hotel is highly recommended.
reviews.title: Loved the Le Lavoisier

reviews.text: The Bolden from Santa Monica, CA
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

likes.liked: — Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay in this hotel everytime I am in Paris which is twice a year.
reviews.title: Nice boutique style, but check what you have booked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In 2005, I brought 8 of my friends from the US and they all decided they will also stay in this hotel when they all go back to Paris.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is friendly and accomodating especially Fabienne, Nisha and Ludovic. It's great to see the same familiar faces each time, which definitely gives a meaning to the saying - "home away from home." The room is clean especially
reviews.title: 4 nights at Lavoisier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first visit to Paris was made even better than we imagined by our decision to stay at Hotel Le Lavoisier. We have traveled extensively at quite luxurious levels to many other parts of Europe and elsewhere in the world, even eastern France, but somehow had not been able to get to to this historic and beautiful city before. We have very high standards and expectations, but decided on this trip to avoid the luxury hotels and seek a more intimate and hopefully still attractive, friendly, and comfortable BOUTIQUE STYLE LODGING for this trip. This rennovated and updated townhome once owned by the French scientist Lavoisier was a WONDERFUL FIND.
reviews.title: Everything We Expected and More

likes.disliked: — Go to one of the Ritz Hotel bars for a memorable cocktail experience.

reviews.text: On our arrival and every day thereafter we were greeted warmly by the gracioius staff who made us (and every other guest that we observed arrive or depart during our stay) feel that we were who they had been waiting for.
reviews.title: Worked for us

reviews.text: As a couple who hates (in spite of our preparatory research) to have every minute scheduled before they arrive and who like to make it up as we go along, the hotel's CONCIERGE SERVICES, especially Fabienne and Ludovic, were really the proverbial" icing on our cake," providing us with EXCELLENT advice and service in every category you can imagine. They enjoyed my attempts to communicate in rusty basic French, and warmly responded in perfect English (& for other nationalities in a mutually understood language). They arranged for all our delightful dining experiences, willingly reviewed and culled our well researched list with us and even added some wonderful ideas of their own, which turned out to be excellent. They helped us to find the most convenient and (where requested) cost effective ways to see and experience as much of their fabulous city as possible in the week we had there. Whatever level of service we requested, they found a source for us and the quality was always excellent and did not disappoint. We especially enjoyed our outing to Versailles arranged by the hotel. We traveled by minivan in the company of three other English speaking couples from Canada and Australia with a young Frenchman as our driver and professional guide. His knowledge and ability to share it were "incroyable!"
reviews.title: Le Lavoisier, classy,cool and chic.,

likes.liked: — Price, quality of hotel,cleanliness, location, staff
likes.disliked: — watch out for the suite on the second floor that looks straight onto the wall of the next building.

reviews.title: Great Hotel with a few reservations
reviews.text: Every morning NIsha greeted us in Lavoisier's cheerful, cozy lower level cafe with his freshly brewed coffee in our own little pot and our own baker's basket of many fresh breads. The hotel offered this and more daily at the CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST buffet (INCLUDED in the price of the room) with more selections than one would expect in a small boutique hotel. (For those who choose to go elsewhere and want a full breakfast, numerous cafes are just steps away in any direction.) One evening we sat and enjoyed cocktails in the relaxing and elegant self-serve, HONOR BAR tucked just off the lobby with another couple staying at the hotel. It was then we planned our cocktail hour outing with them to the Ritz Bar toward the end of our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The LOCATION of this CHIC hotel is terrific, too, just a few minutes walk north of the Place de La Concorde, with the Champs Elysee in one direction and the Tuileries and Louvre in the other, just a few minutes from one of the "hop on/hop off" tour bus companies main stops, and just south of Hausmann and a taxi stand, the metro, Rue Faubourg, the Opera Garnier and the French department stores. Each day after roaming the streets, museums, historic sights, gardens,shops and restaurants, we returned to the comfort of our spotlessly CLEAN room with its SOPHISTICATED DECOR, COMFORTABLE BED with plump, soft pillows and lovely, up to date MARBLE BATH. We had asked when making reservations to be on the quieter side of the building away from the street and our request was honored without hesitation. The hotel is located just off Malsherbe and a bit north of the Madeleine Church in an area that is fairly quiet in the evenings anyway. It was nice to have the choice to enjoy the two grand French door style windows open or closed, when we needed the air conditioning system on a couple of warm September nights.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.disliked: — No shower curtain - very minor complaint!

description: Who has never dreamt of enjoying a gentle night in a decor which is peaceful but joyous, elegant but modern, comfortable but contemporary. Or, of different places which we feel could be “like home”. Yet, this is a hotel room, my hotel room, where I would like to find myself one evening after a day of work in an unknown city, or for a romantic weekend, when this room was the site which we preferred the most.
